website_summaries.verdict: The Ricoh Theta is compact camera that captures unique 360° spherical images, but it's on the pricey side and battery life is disappointing.

customer_reviews.title: Anyone with average photo editing skills can EASILY negate all the cons of this device.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has lots of complaints, but as a graphic designer, I can get around the shotty software/sharing limitations of "print screen" functions and editing straight to whatever platform I want. I LOVE making logos for people with this. Bands, landscapes, everything! I love the big ideas of this camera and think this 360 instant click form will take over all of photography/video in 5-10 years. This camera would be perfect if it was 50+ MP rather than about 5 MP like it is now. Video mode would be great as well since Oculus Rift is launching ~2015 and I can't wait for that either! Exciting times people :D
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for taking 360-degree photos
customer_reviews.text: I need to take photos of existing homes and businesses in order to create building plans for my design and drafting business. This camera is a god-send. With this camera I only have to go to the job site once to record existing conditions. Each photo shows a 360-degree view plus up and down. It's easy to use and fast. Typically I stand out of camera view and take the photo using my cell phone. I recommend using it with the Grifiti Nootle Stand tripod, because the latter has a very small profile that won't take up much room in your pictures.
customer_reviews.author: CADmeister

customer_reviews.title: delivers exactly what was promised.
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who just wants to press one button - or better yet, remotely capture a panoramic using your smartphone - and find equirectangular panoramas waiting in memory, this is an ideal solution. I haven't been able to get the desktop program to run, but this might be Windows 8's fault. I was able to load the android app onto my BlackBerry and it works flawlessly but it does drain the battery for some reason. As I've read in other reviews, the image quality suffers only a little in low light. And the resolution won't be enough for Occulus Rift users, but if you like to play with different panoramic projections (i.e., stereographic little planets, this won't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: David Swart

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy panoramas!
customer_reviews.text: I've been involved in 360 panoramic photography for many years. Usually the process involves a number of photographs and a lot of hoping that nothing moves in the process. Half bodies and blurred cars are often the result. With this camera you can do the same process in one click. You can hold the camera yourself and be in the photo, or use your phone to remotely trigger the device. The resolution of the images isn't quite as high as the multi image process, but for fun shots it's fine.

customer_reviews.title: Good enough

Easy to download the pictures from your mobile to your pc to work with Panorama software.

customer_reviews.title: For those with more money than brains
customer_reviews.text: Cute gimmick that may be improved upon in the future. Also 'way too expensive for what you get. Guess Ricoh needs to recoup all that research and development money. I thought the thing was cute when I ran across reference to it on the Internet. Then, I went to the Ricoh site and looked at their sample picture. It was only a little better than what a pinhole camera could produce in terms of sharpness, albeit without the spherical view for the latter. So, no thanks. I'll stick with my DSLRs.

product_meta.title: Ricoh Theta Digital Camera (White)
product_meta.description: The Theta from Ricoh is a compact and lightweight (3.3 oz.) camera that has a lens on both the front and back, allowing you to take full 360 Degree spherical panoramic images in with one shot. The device is synchronized with smartphones, where images can be immediately transmitted via Wi-Fi and viewed with a dedicated free app. The app also allows images to be pinched, swiped or rotated to edit size, shape and composition. Images uploaded to theta360.com can be shared on social networks such as Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr, as well as Microsoft Corporation’s Photosynth. IOS and Android free apps for viewing and capturing images.
feature_bullets: 360 Degree spherical panoramic camera w/ 4GB internal memory
Wireless Sharing: Spherical images can be easily shared with friends by posting to Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr directly from iOS and Android apps.
The app can be used to take remote images. The app expands your flexibility by allowing you to capture images when standing away from RICOH THETA.
You can use the app to view spherical images. The app allows you to swipe and pinch spherical images so you can find and enjoy your favorite perspective!

You can register location information in spherical images by connecting your RICOH THETA wirelessly to your smart phone and using the phone's GPS information. Use location information to expand the ways you use and enjoy spherical images.
